content: Plots with road cuts have not been allotted and no plot is located on lands not acquired from the farmers, say officials

title: Lorry owners urge A.P. govt. to put on hold vehicle tracking device norm
content: New vehicle registrations should be allowed without insisting on installation of a VLTD until the technical and other issues related to the devices are resolved, says Andhra Pradesh Lorry Owners' Association

title: Children hid in closet: Indian national, 3 relatives shot dead in family dispute in US
content: An Indian national was among four people killed in a Georgia shooting linked to an alleged family dispute. Police identified the suspect as Vijay Kumar, who has been charged with multiple counts, including murder. Three children were found unharmed inside the residence and are now in family care.

title: ‚ÄòNot inferior to anyone in patriotism‚Äô: Stalin hits out at TN governor
content: Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin sharply criticized governor RN Ravi in the state assembly, accusing him of undermining constitutional conventions by refusing to read his customary address. Stalin highlighted the Dravidian model government's achievements and dismissed law and order concerns.

title: Sabotage? Explosion damages Amritsar‚ÄìDelhi railway line in Fatehgarh Sahib; loco pilot injured
content: A suspected sabotage incident rocked the Amritsar-Delhi railway line in Punjab late Friday night. An explosion near Khanpur village, Fatehgarh Sahib, damaged approximately 12 feet of track, injuring a freight train's loco pilot. Authorities are investigating the blast, which occurred around 12:30 am Saturday. Restoration efforts are underway with enhanced security.

title: Netflix-Warner Bros merger bid: Greg Peters rejects Paramount‚Äôs $108bn offer
content: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Accenture's leader-led AI training: Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: 'Palash Muchhal was caught red-handed': Smriti Mandhana's childhood friend makes big claim
content: Actor-producer Vidnyan Mane has accused singer-composer Palaash Muchhal of infidelity and financial misconduct, leading to a police complaint in Sangli, Maharashtra. Mane alleges Muchhal was caught with another woman during wedding festivities and claims he was cheated of over Rs 40 lakh in a film project. Muchhal has denied all accusations, calling them baseless and factually incorrect.

title: Penguins in Greenland? The story behind the viral ‚ÄòNihilist Penguin‚Äô meme
content: President Trump's AI-generated image of a penguin in Greenland, featuring a geographical error, has gone viral. This coincides with a resurfaced documentary clip of a lone penguin, dubbed 'Nihilist Penguin,' sparking online debate about existentialism and rebellion, though scientists attribute the behavior to disorientation or illness.

title: New fissure? After Greenland thaw, Trump-Europe tensions reignite ‚Äî what triggered row this time
content: President Trump's remarks questioning NATO allies' sacrifices in Afghanistan and their commitment to the US have ignited anger across Europe. Leaders from the UK, France, and Poland have strongly rebuked the comments, highlighting their own significant losses and unwavering support for the alliance. This latest dispute underscores growing European concerns about a transactional US foreign policy.

title: Amazon layoffs: Company to cut 14,000 more jobs
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Budget 2026: What banks and financial services expect from FM this time?
content: The banking sector anticipates targeted policy support in Union Budget 2026 to address credit constraints and rising NPAs in unsecured loans. Key expectations include enhanced MSME credit guarantees, co-lending schemes, and continued digital financial inclusion support. The industry also seeks incentives for pension and insurance adoption and regulatory relief for rural banks.

title: Fast-tracked visas await 2026 T20 World Cup fans
content: World Cup 2026 attendees can expect faster US visas. Brand USA is facilitating the process for ticket holders. Curated experiences like road trips on Route 66 are planned. Indian travelers will find familiar communities in host cities like New Jersey and New York. AI tools will assist in planning multi-city itineraries for the event.

title: Diary entry reveals why a NEET aspirant from UP amputated his foot
content: A 24-year-old man from Jaunpur allegedly severed part of his left foot to claim disability benefits for NEET medical admission. Initially reporting an attack, police uncovered his motive through his diary and girlfriend's statement, revealing his desperation for MBBS admission. He reportedly used a machine and possibly anesthetics for the act.

title: Davos 2026: Musk, Trump reconcile at memorial; policy rift on US solar energy emerges
content: Elon Musk and Donald Trump have reportedly reconciled, attending a memorial together in September 2025.  Despite this apparent truce, Musk recently diverged from Trump's stance on energy at the World Economic Forum, advocating for solar power to meet America's growing electricity demands, a move contrasting with Trump's pro-oil policies.

title: Revealed! Why Suryakumar Yadav was angry at Ishan Kishan
content: Suryakumar Yadav lauded Ishan Kishan's fearless batting after India's seven-wicket win over New Zealand.  Kishan's aggressive 76 and Yadav's 82 powered a remarkable chase, reflecting the team's desired free-flowing approach. Despite bowling struggles, the team restricted New Zealand to a manageable total.

title: 'Surgical, kinetic ... ': Iran warns US of 'all-out war' over 'military build-up' in Middle East
content: Iran has issued a stern warning, stating any attack will be treated as an all-out war, amid the deployment of a US aircraft carrier strike group and other military assets to the Middle East. Tehran's military is on high alert, prepared for the worst-case scenario as tensions escalate following US-backed Israeli strikes and President Trump's close watch on Iran.

title: Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
content: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Reggie Miller says Stephen Curry should call Giannis as Father Time looms
content: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Ray Daniels sparks outrage with explosive LeBron‚ÄìKobe comparison
content: Music executive Ray Daniels faced widespread backlash with a controversial statement comparing LeBron James and Kobe Bryant, suggesting Bryant had a "daddy" while James did not. This personal remark, made on his podcast, shifted the debate from basketball to respect and boundaries, drawing sharp criticism from fans who deemed it unnecessary and attention-seeking.

title: 'Scolded for returning drunk': BTech student dies after jumping from Greater Noida hostel
content: A 20-year-old BTech student, Udit Soni, died after jumping from the fourth floor of EZ Stays hostel in Greater Noida. Police reported the incident occurred after the hostel manager scolded him for returning drunk. Authorities have taken custody of the body and are investigating the circumstances.

title: Illinois siblings suffer from Sanfilippo syndrome: Doctor explains the rare disorder
content: An Illinois couple is raising two children, Poppy and Oliver, who suffer from Sanfilippo syndrome, a rare genetic disorder also known as childhood dementia. This condition causes a progressive decline in cognitive and motor skills, leading to significant challenges for affected families. Currently, there is no cure, and treatments focus on managing symptoms and exploring new therapies.

title: Gujarat University appoints chemistry professor as English HOD
content: Hemchandracharya North Gujarat University faced legal challenges after appointing a chemistry professor as the in-charge head of its English department. A court questioned the university's decision, leading to the reversal of the appointment. The aggrieved faculty member can now challenge the new proposed head.

title: Will rain continue in Delhi-NCR? IMD forecasts dip in minimum temperature
content: New Delhi experienced its highest single-day rainfall in January in three years on Friday, with 13.2 mm recorded. Overcast skies and gusty winds kept temperatures unusually high for the minimum and low for the maximum. While a dip in minimum temperatures is expected, coldwave conditions are unlikely.

title: 7 riders, 1 bike, zero sense: VIP Road viral video stuns netizens; cops launch probe to identify youths
content: Seven young men were filmed riding a single motorcycle without helmets on Bhopal's VIP Road, a video that has gone viral. The reckless stunt, captured in broad daylight amidst heavy traffic, has sparked outrage online. Authorities are investigating the incident, reviewing CCTV footage to identify the individuals and the vehicle involved.

title: Masseuse assaults woman for cancelling treatment in Mumbai's Wadala; video goes viral
content: A Mumbai woman alleges she was assaulted by a massage therapist from an app-based service after cancelling a session midway due to discomfort. The therapist reportedly became enraged, verbally abused, and physically attacked the 46-year-old victim in Wadala. Police are investigating the incident, with a video of the event circulating online.

title: ‚ÄòChina will eat them up‚Äô: Trump slams Canada over pushback on ‚ÄòGolden Dome‚Äô plan in Greenland
content: US President Donald Trump criticized Canada for opposing his "Golden Dome" missile defense system over Greenland, accusing Ottawa of prioritizing economic ties with China. Trump asserted Canada's security relies on the US, a claim rejected by Canadian PM Mark Carney, who emphasized Canadian sovereignty and thriving independently. The dispute highlights ongoing bilateral tensions and differing approaches to international relations.

title: UAE orders release for 900+ Indian prisoners ahead of National Day
content: The UAE has released over 900 Indian prisoners as part of a humanitarian pardon ordered by President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan. This significant gesture, coinciding with National Day celebrations, includes the clearing of financial penalties, enabling a genuine fresh start for the inmates. The release strengthens the deep-rooted brotherhood and goodwill between the UAE and India.

title: The question that brought Ishan Kishan back: 'Can I do it or not?'
content: Ishan Kishan's powerful 76 off 32 balls marked a triumphant return to the Indian jersey after a two-year hiatus.  He rediscovered his form through domestic cricket, answering his own doubts about his capability to perform at the international level.  Kishan's confident mindset and strategic approach were key to chasing a daunting target.

title: Actor Kamaal R Khan arrested by Mumbai police for firing incident at residential building
content: Actor Kamaal Rashid Khan, also known as KRK, was reportedly arrested on Saturday in connection with a firing incident. He allegedly admitted to firing two rounds from his licensed firearm at a residential building in Mumbai's Oshiwara area on January 18. No casualties were reported in the incident.

title: Donna Kelce sparks Travis Kelce retirement rumors, wedding plans on hold
content: Donna Kelce shared a Times Square billboard promoting a new Kelce brothers project tied to their New Heights podcast, drawing attention as Travis Kelce weighs retirement. While remaining quiet about his NFL future, Travis continues expanding his off field ventures. A recent excited comment about the Chiefs‚Äô coaching move has further fueled speculation that he may return next season.

title: Will stop BMC chief‚Äôs salary if AQI doesn‚Äôt improve: Bombay HC
content: Bombay High Court has sternly criticized the BMC for its lax approach to Mumbai's pollution control, threatening to withhold the municipal commissioner's salary. Judges noted a lack of sincere effort and a "belligerent disregard" for court orders, particularly regarding Navi Mumbai's affidavit. This strong stance signals a potential financial penalty for non-compliance.

title: Still eyeing the Arctic? White House posts AI image of Trump with penguin in Greenland
content: President Trump is intensifying his focus on Greenland, with the White House releasing an AI-generated image of him with a penguin to highlight the strategic importance of the Arctic island. Trump has cited security concerns regarding Russia and China, sparking backlash from allies. He also criticized Canada's opposition to a missile defense project, warning of Chinese influence.

title: Canada offers research lifeline to Indian talent amid US headwinds in higher education drive
content: Canada is expanding academic engagement with India as Indians face headwinds in the US higher education system. Universities Canada will lead 21 Canadian university presidents on a multi-city India mission to explore research collaboration, academic exchange and transnational education. The initiative aligns with renewed bilateral ties, CEPA negotiations, Canada‚Äôs $1.7-billion research strategy and upcoming high-level visits, strengthening long-term education, research and industry partnerships across government, academia and innovation ecosystems in both countries over coming years.

title: 'Let's seize the moment': Von der Leyen sees EU-India FTA
content: EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen anticipates a watershed moment for EU-India ties with a Free Trade Agreement and a new defence partnership expected from the upcoming summit.  She highlighted the potential for significant economic gains from the FTA and enhanced security cooperation in a volatile world.

title: Noida techie death: Non-bailable warrant against plot shareholder Nirmal Singh
content: A non-bailable warrant has been issued for Lotus Greens founder Nirmal Singh in connection with the drowning death of engineer Yuvraj Mehta. Singh is absconding, with police warning of property attachment if he doesn't surrender. He faces charges under environmental acts and BNS sections for negligence and public nuisance.

title: Do alcohol-free ‚Äòonly weekend drinking‚Äô habits still damage the liver?
content: Weekend-only drinking, often perceived as responsible, can still significantly harm the liver. Experts emphasize that the amount and speed of alcohol consumption, rather than the number of alcohol-free days, are key factors in liver damage. This pattern can lead to silent, progressive liver disease, especially for those with pre-existing health conditions.

title: Budget 2026 metal sector expectations: MMTC-PAMP pushes for duty parity for refiners
content: India's precious metal refiners are urging the government to address duty disparities that disadvantage local operations compared to imported refined bullion. MMTC-PAMP highlights a mismatch in import duties, particularly through the SEPA route, impacting domestic refiners' competitiveness. The industry seeks policy support, including input-related benefits and wider duty differentials, to bolster India's refining capacity and global standing.

title: Delhi AQI at 256 in ‚Äòpoor‚Äô category; visibility improves, minimum temperatures to drop 5‚Äì6¬∞C over next 3 days
content: Delhi experienced clear skies on Saturday after Friday's heavy rainfall, bringing a slight improvement in air quality to the 'poor' category. Moderate fog and strong winds are expected, with minimum temperatures anticipated to fall by 5-6¬∞C over the next three days. Despite the rain, air quality remained poor across several city areas.

title: Blue room, broken wall: Clues from 10-year-old help nab rape accused
content: Abandoned slippers and a broken wall in a forested ridge led police to crack a sexual assault case involving a 10-year-old girl. Investigators identified a red e-rickshaw with a white roof from CCTV footage, ultimately leading to the arrest of the 25-year-old suspect, Durgesh.

title: Gym syndicate in UP targeted Hindu women for conversion; GRP head constable among 6 held
content: A Mirzapur gym syndicate was busted for an illegal religious conversion and AI-backed blackmail racket targeting up to 30 women. The gang created AI-generated obscene videos of Hindu women to coerce them into religious conversion and sexual exploitation. Six accused, including a police constable, have been arrested.

title: US braces for historic winter storm; power outage risks mount, flights cancelled
content: A colossal winter tempest is wreaking havoc across a significant portion of the United States, bringing with it an onslaught of freezing rain and subzero Arctic air. Meteorologists are alerting residents that the storm might cause devastation akin to hurricane-force conditions. With life-threatening wind chills becoming common, the risk of frostbite looms large.

title: Nick Castellanos‚Äô wife Jessica‚Äôs comment adds charm to Realmuto‚Äôs family moment
content: ‚Äã J.T. Realmuto and his wife, Alexis, had a relaxing family photo that instantly hit a chord with the fans. The image was shot in a relaxed setting on a peaceful beach background with soft and neutral color, which provided a feeling of comfort and unity between the family. As fans reacted warmly to the post, one comment stood out for its familiarity and humor. Nick Castellanos‚Äô wife, Jessica Castellanos, shared a response that blended affection with an easy sense of fun.

title: 'Border 2' box office collections Day 1: Sunny Deol starrer earns Rs 30 crore
content: 'Border 2' has made a powerful debut at the box office, exceeding expectations with an impressive Rs 30 crore net collection on its opening day. The war drama, starring Sunny Deol, secured a significant Rs 17 crore in advance bookings, positioning it among the highest first-day collections in Bollywood history.

title: Expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: 8 years, 5 schools and a career-threatening condition: The story of Tyon Grant-Foster
content: Tyon Grant-Foster won a game-saving block on the perimeter to force overtime . the 6-foot-7 forward helped the Bulldogs claw back in the second half . he will have suited up for five different schools by the time he turns 26 in march .

title: Sources: OT Seaton joining LSU, leaves Colorado
content: OT Seaton is the top offensive tackle and no. 4 overall player in ESPN's transfer rankings . the 6-foot-5, 330-pound sophomore was one of the highest-rated signees in Colorado program history as a five-star recruit in the 2024 class .

title: Seahawks' Darnold good to go for NFC title game
content: sam darnold and his injured oblique are good to go for the NFC title game . he was limited in practice all three days this week as part of the team's plan to get him ready to play Sunday against the los Angeles Rams at Lumen Field . "i feel really good," he said Friday .

title: Study finds strikes disrupt satellite signals; causes possible GPS errors ‚Äî here's how
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines ‚Äî Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few ‚Äî  but is based out of Bengaluru, India‚Äôs science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ.
